nodes.title: TSMC
nodes.short_description: Primary foundry manufacturing Qualcomm's advanced Snapdragon and modem chips; capacity and nodes determine performance â€¦

nodes.title: Samsung Electronics
nodes.short_description: Major customer, competitor, and foundry; decisions on Exynos, sourcing, and fabs impact Qualcomm volumes and pricing.

nodes.title: U.S. export controls on China/Huawei
nodes.short_description: BIS restrictions dictate Qualcomm's ability to sell advanced chips to Chinese OEMs, especially Huawei.

nodes.title: China
nodes.short_description: Largest smartphone market and OEM base; policies and demand strongly influence Qualcomm revenue.

nodes.title: MediaTek
nodes.short_description: Main competitor in smartphone SoCs; pricing and feature race affect Qualcomm share and margins.

nodes.title: Huawei
nodes.short_description: Key Chinese OEM and chipset rival; U.S. sanctions on Huawei directly alter Qualcomm's China sales.

nodes.title: Arm Holdings
nodes.short_description: Licenses CPU and ISA IP underlying Snapdragon; terms and disputes influence Qualcomm's core designs and timelines.

nodes.title: 3GPP cellular standards
nodes.short_description: Defines 3G/4G/5G specifications guiding Qualcomm modem, RF front-end, and licensing strategies.

nodes.title: Smartphone industry
nodes.short_description: Primary end-market driving Qualcomm chipset and modem demand, pricing, and product cycles.

nodes.title: Android
nodes.short_description: Dominant mobile OS shaping Snapdragon features, ecosystem alignment, and OEM demand.

nodes.title: United States
nodes.short_description: Home jurisdiction shaping antitrust outcomes, export controls, and government technology priorities affecting Qualcomm.

nodes.title: FTC v. Qualcomm Ninth Circuit reversal (2020)
nodes.short_description: Ninth Circuit reversed antitrust ruling, maintaining Qualcomm's licensing model and bargaining leverage.

nodes.title: CFIUS blocks Broadcom acquisition (2018)
nodes.short_description: U.S. national security order blocked Broadcom's takeover, preserving Qualcomm's independence and 5G roadmap.

nodes.title: Cristiano Amon
nodes.short_description: Qualcomm CEO steering diversification, partnerships, and execution across handsets, RF, automotive, and licensing.
